{"step_by_step_thinking": "The WHO collaborating centers, as per the documents, are institutions that work with the World Health Organization in various disciplines such as occupational health, food safety, and communicable disease prevention. They perform research, provide training, and offer other services to further the WHO health agenda. They also play a role in the control and prevention of diseases like AIDS. They are involved in the establishment of international standards for vaccines and in the area of standardization of vaccines and biotherapeutics. They also contribute to the development of health research partnerships and the promotion of the scientific bases of public health. Therefore, they are involved in the collection, collation, and dissemination of information, functioning and forming new guidelines/definitions for diseases, and contact with grass root workers.", "answer_choice": "A, B, C"}
